subproject.description: The Project addresses to one of the priorities identified in the Solomon Islands National Adaptation Programme of Action (NAPA); agriculture and food security as one of the most vulnerable sectors requiring urgent attention.  The objective of the project is to strengthening ability of communities in Solomon Islands to make informed decisions and manage likely climate change driven pressures on food production and management system through three outcomes: 1) promote and pilot community adaptation activities enhancing food security and livelihood resilience in pilot communities in at least three selected regions, 2) strengthen institutions and adjusted national and sub-national policies related to governing agriculture in the context of a range of climate change future, and 3) foster the generation and spread of relevant knowledge for assisting decision-making at the community and policy-formulation level . The total allocated resource is $5,100,000 from the Adaptation Fund for four years. Adaptation Fund Board endorsed the Project in March 2011.
subproject.title: SOI AF PIMS 4451 Res to Advers

title: SOI AF PIMS4451 Resilience of communities to CCA
